intro: Psychotria flavida, commonly known as the yellow psychotria, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers and elliptical leaves with a smooth surface. It typically grows in tropical rainforests and is often found in shaded, moist environments. Psychotria flavida is also known for its chemical compounds, some of which have been studied for potential medicinal properties.
